reviews.review_msg: CRIM 455- 20% Participation. 30% Presentation, and a 50% 20 page paper.  We did not use the textbook at all and each class was a discussion of a particular policing topic.  He brings in lots of guest speakers and is an overall fair marker. No tests, but a negative: you dont know any of your marks until after classes are done.

Dr. Griffiths is a FANTASTIC professor! Hes top tier and a chill professor. He knows what hes talking about. When he does talk, youll never get bored since theres always something new to learn from him. Despite the many brief papers, you get a lot of value from the readings. His guest speakers add to the wonderful class experience as well.

Curt is an amazing professor & the course was enjoyable. A large part of your mark is participation so you need to come to class and contribute. There were 5 essay's, so quite a bit of reading for each of these because you need to reference the different articles. He is a completely fair marker and the guest speakers were very knowledgeable.

He is one of the best professor I ever had in my university life. His course is designed full of eye-opening and impressive contents that you can't get from other courses. He is very caring. Saying good morning to individual students is not a major thing nor related to the course, but certainly makes you feel welcomed.

To start off, Curt hands down one of the best profs at SFU. The 4 Brief notes in this class is okay. Participation is worth 40% so you have to talk and show up. There are a lot of guest speakers, and it is okay to challenge the guest speakers in this class, even though some may have a narrow mindset. Curt is all about discussion so dont be afraid.

Curt Griffiths is the best Professor in the SFU Criminology Department by far. Great guy that genuinely cares for the well-being of his students and wants them to excel. He's handled the COVID-19 scare during this semester professionally and compassionately. Thanks Prof Griffiths!

THE BEST PROF AT SFU HANDS DOWN! I have never met a professor so caring for his students in my entire life. This class is fun, interactive and interesting. The guest speakers were amazing and the briefing notes were a good overview for what you are learning. Overall he is amazing and I cannot stress that enough! Every prof needs to be like him!

Curt is hands down the best professor at SFU. I'm sad I didn't take his classes earlier on in my degree. He is a fair marker for briefing notes (which are worth 60% of your grade). He genuinely cares for his students.

Such a funny guy. Super friendly. Brought in a ton of guest speakers from different sectors of the CJS. You will be lucky if you get in this class. His briefing notes were marked a bit tough IMO, but still easy to do. Take this course you won't regret it.

Curt is awesome, definitely an expert when it comes to policing and one of the best in the CRIM department. CRIM 455 consists of a number of briefing papers (summary of readings) almost each week, participation, and a final journal. Not a difficult class and I looked forward to attending each week. 4 classes were at VPD and weekly guest speakers.
Can't say enough nice things about him. He is easily the best professor in SFU's criminology department. I would take this same class every year with him if I could.

Has a wealth of knowledge on policing issues. Fun class with lots of field trips. Gives you a good opportunity to see policing in the real world and allows you to interact with Cops. Very informative class. Would definitely recommend this class or any one of Curt's other classes!

Best teacher in the crim department and at SFU. Always makes time for his students especially if you are in your fourth year. If you are interested in policing this is the prof to keep in touch with he knows the ins and outs. Also make sure to take Crim 455 cause you will make great contact with VPD!

Best prof at sfu! Very easy and enjoyable class. He used his contacts to arrange great policing field trips for the class. Journal assignments were quite easy to do. Also, he is very funny and easy-going. Overall: 9/10
